subject: Communication
title: The Story Spine: Pixar's Secret
description: A 60-second lesson on The Story Spine: Pixar's Secret.

hook.text: Pixar tells stories that make adults cry in the first ten minutes. They use a deceptively simple formula.

buildup.text: The Story Spine: 'Once upon a time... Every day... Until one day... Because of that... Until finally...'

discovery.text: Created by improv teacher Kenn Adams, this framework forces cause-and-effect â€” the engine of compelling narrative.

twist.text: Most bad stories fail at 'because of that.' They list events without causation. Things just... happen.

climax.text: Pixar's rule: 'Coincidences to get characters into trouble are great; coincidences to get them out are cheating.'

punchline.text: Great stories aren't about what happens. They're about why.

quiz.question: What does the Story Spine force storytellers to focus on?
